com.yantra.api.ycp.task

Interface createBatchForReferences

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi
    Deprecated. 
    as of 9.2.

    public interface createBatchForReferences

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createBatchForReferences(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      Deprecated. 
      The createBatchForReferences API creates the batches for the passed task references.

    • Method Detail

      • createBatchForReferences

        org.w3c.dom.Document createBatchForReferences(YFSEnvironment env,
                                              org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                       throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                              java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        The createBatchForReferences API creates the batches for the passed task references. This API creates optimal batches for all the eligible tasks for a task type based on Cost Based Optimization by using the Constraint Based Solver.

        Following constraints are applied
        • Maximum number of tasks in a batch

        • Max number of references (could be max # of shipments / containers/move request etc). This is based on task type configuration. This constraint is applied to each location on the equipment.

        • Do not split container when batching is container based (this is implicit)

        • Do not split shipment when batching is shipment based (this is implicit)

        • Capacity of an equipment. This is based on equipment type configuration for that task type. Capacity of equipment is defined through locations that are defined for the equipment type. System performs a volume check and critical dimension check before assigning a location. If equipment type is set onto batch rule then batch size is restricted to equipment capacity. In this case batch locations are created identifying clearly where to place unique reference.
        Note: For task type with activity code "ItemPick", capacity of equipment is the only constraint.

        Cost based optimization is done by associating cost with locations, aisles, zones and batches. The costs are taken from SAM definition in productivity module. The costs are added up in a batch, and across batches for the input criteria but within a task type. Different solutions with different costs are compared, and the solution with the least cost is selected. Standard allowable minutes (SAM) from productivity type definition associated with the task type are used to get the optimal solution. Following SAMs are used to compute a batch cost.
        • SAM per Productivity Batch

        • SAM per Source Location

        • SAM per Source Aisle

        • SAM per Item

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        This user exit is called before creating a batch. Tasks chosen for the batch are passed to the user exit. If input xml needs to be changed for any reason or any processing has to be done before executing the API, this can be done by this user exit. Batch is created for the tasks returned by the user exit. Note: The user exit does not return batch locations. com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPBeforecreateBatchForReferencesUE

        Events Raised:

          This api internally calls createBatch api. Check javadocs of createBatch api for details about the events raised.

        Template Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No


Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
Returns:
An XML document which has details about the batch created. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
